page.title: 02STUDLAND OCCUPATIONS
page.content: Studland has two general stores and a post office which require few workers. Hotel car-parks, kiosks and the{ {National Trust}shop provide a few more jobs.The Beach Warden is responsible for safety of tourists packing the beaches.Local{Guest Houses}are busy during the 'season',a source of more part-time jobs.Milk and dairy products are delivered by Mr.R.Vine, a farmer. The bulk of the working population works in the shops,offices,factories and warehouses in the conurbation of { {Poole}and{Bournemouth}across Poole Harbour.Many people prefer to use the chain ferry which links the Isle of Purbeck with Sandbanks to the North,a way of shortening the daily journey by 26 miles.
